comments.body: Should this extend CoarseGrainedClusterMessage as well?
comments.diffHunk:
@@ -92,6 +94,11 @@ private[spark] object CoarseGrainedClusterMessages {
       hostToLocalTaskCount: Map[String, Int])
     extends CoarseGrainedClusterMessage
 
+  // Check if an executor was force-killed but for a normal reason
+  // This could be the case if e.g. the cluster manager supports killing an executor to
+  // move it elsewhere or to kill an executor in order to free resources
+  case class GetExecutorLossReason(executorId: String)

@@ -92,6 +94,11 @@ private[spark] object CoarseGrainedClusterMessages {
       hostToLocalTaskCount: Map[String, Int])
     extends CoarseGrainedClusterMessage
 
+  // Check if an executor was force-killed but for a normal reason
+  // This could be the case if e.g. the cluster manager supports killing an executor to
+  // move it elsewhere or to kill an executor in order to free resources
+  case class GetExecutorLossReason(executorId: String)

@@ -21,6 +21,7 @@ import java.nio.ByteBuffer
 
 import org.apache.spark.TaskState.TaskState
 import org.apache.spark.rpc.RpcEndpointRef
+import org.apache.spark.scheduler.{SlaveLost, ExecutorLossReason}

comments.body: I would just say `This could happen if the executor is preempted, for instance.`
